conclusion: Determine the magnitude and direction of the frictional force at t = 2.5 s.
Calculate magnetic field at t = 2.5 s: B = 8 T.
Side length of wire frame is 0.2 m; half is in magnetic field.
Area of wire frame in magnetic field: A = 0.02 m².
Magnetic flux through wire frame: Φ = 0.16 Wb.
Magnetic field B is a function of time: B = (3 + 2t) T.
Rate of change of magnetic field: dB/dt = 2 T/s.
Rate of change of magnetic flux: dΦ/dt = 0.04 Wb/s.
Induced emf given by Faraday's law: ε = -dΦ/dt.
Induced emf in wire frame: ε = -0.04 V.
Current in wire frame given by Ohm's law: I = ε/R.
Current in wire frame: I = 0.01 A.
Force on current-carrying wire in magnetic field: F = BIL.
Length of wire segment in magnetic field is side length: L = 0.2 m.
Force on wire frame: F = 0.16 N.
Direction of force given by right-hand rule; frictional force opposes motion.
Frictional force direction: opposite to force due to magnetic field.
Final answer: Frictional force is 0.16 N, opposite to magnetic field force.
